Title: Buyer
Description: A buyer is an entity whose budget will be used to pay for goods, works or services related to a contract.

Title: Procuring entity
Description: The entity managing the procurement. This can be different from the buyer who pays for, or uses, the items being procured.

Title: Supplier
Description: An entity awarded or contracted to provide goods, works or services.

Title: Tenderer
Description: All entities who submit a tender.

Title: Funder
Description: The funder is an entity providing money or finance for this contracting process.

Title: Enquirer
Description: A party who has made an enquiry during the enquiry phase of a contracting process.

Title: Payer
Description: A party making a payment from a transaction.

Title: Payee
Description: A party in receipt of a payment from a transaction.

Title: Review body
Description: A party responsible for the review of this procurement process. This party often has a role in any challenges made to the contract award.

Title: Interested party
Description: A party that has expressed an interest in the contracting process: for example, by purchasing tender documents or submitting clarification questions.

Title: Private party
Description: The counter party of the procuring authority in the PPP contract. A private entity which has been granted the contract to construct and operate a government asset, and which is usually created under the form of a Special Purpose Vehicle or SPV.

Title: Lead bank
Description: A lead bank is a bank that oversees the arrangement of a loan syndication

Title: Lender
Description: The APMG PPP Certification Program defines lenders as "Institutions that provide lending to the project: mainly banks and institutional investors through project bonds"

Title: Equity investor
Description: The APMG PPP Certification Program defines equity investors as "Investors who finance a portion of the projectâ€™s capital expenditures (Capex), typically as share capital or subordinated debt"

Title: Consortia member
Description: One of a group of companies that has joined together to bid for a project.

Title: Grantor
Description: The party which grants a concession, a license or some other right.

Title: Social witness
Description: A social witness participates as an external observer in a public procurements process. They have a formal role as an observer.

Title: Other witness
Description: A witness attends one or more stages of the procurement process to observe proceedings.

Title: Notary
Description: A person authorized to perform certain legal formalities, especially to certify documents and proceedings.
